title: tecnografica’s ultralight wallcoverings redefine interiors with glossy, matte & 3D finishes
description: tecnografica’s lightweight aluminum slabs combine advanced digital printing with easy installation, offering customizable finishes for versatile design applications. The post tecnografica’s ultralight wallcoverings redefine interiors with glossy, matte & 3D finishes appeared first on designboom | architecture & design magazine.
author: lisa kostyra
excerpt: tecnografica’s ultralight wallcoverings are customizable and offer superior graphic quality, easy installation, and reduced logistical costs.
text: tecnografica’s aluminum slabs for decorative surfaces‘Ultralight’ is Tecnografica’s solution for decorative surfaces. The ultra-thin aluminum slabs measure just 1.2 mm in thickness but guarantee extraordinary graphic quality thanks to advanced digital printing technologies at very high resolution. Suitable for luxury hotels, residential interiors, and commercial environments like restaurants or retail spaces, the wallcoverings offer full flexibility in both form and function, allowing for customizable designs and finishes.Tecnografica launches ‘Ultralight,’ 1.2mm aluminum slabs with customizable designs and finishes | all images courtesy of Technograficachanging the game in wallcoveringsSince its inception in 1992, Tecnografica has embraced a forward-thinking approach, continually pushing boundaries in wallcovering and decoration design. Guided by the motto ‘The Game is changing,’ the Italian brand seeks to challenge industry norms with cutting-edge technology and bold ideas. Their goal is to serve architecture and design professionals by providing versatile, high-quality products that reflect the latest trends, blending artistic expression with functional design. ‘With ULTRALIGHT we wanted to create a product that was not only aesthetically surprising, but also incredibly functional,’ explains Stefano Lamberti, Head of Sales and Marketing at Tecnografica. ‘We want to offer a versatile and innovative solution that allows, on the one hand, designers and architects to fully express their creativity and, on the other, national and international distributors to access this new covering through a concrete reduction in transport and logistics costs.’despite their ultra-thin profile, the wallcoverings guarantee extraordinary graphic qualityultralight’s three finishes pair function with formAvailable in three finishes – Super Glossy, Matte, and 3D – the ‘Ultralight’ aluminum slabs cater to a variety of design needs. The glossy finish mimics the high elegance of marble and onyx, while the matt finish offers a more understated yet refined touch. Providing depth and texture, the three-dimensional surface replicates natural materials like concrete, wood or fabrics for a more immersive design experience.Beyond aesthetics, ‘Ultralight’ surfaces are highly practical and sustainable thanks to a production process without gas emissions. Their lightweight construction makes them easy to transport and install, significantly reducing logistical costs. Additionally, their resistance to wear, tear, and weather ensures durability in both interior and exterior applications.three finishes are available – Super Glossy, Matte, and 3DSuper Glossy is a mirror-effect finish that replicates polished marble, onyx, glass, and precious stones
html:
tecnografica’s aluminum slabs for decorative surfaces

‘Ultralight’ is Tecnografica’s solution for decorative surfaces. The ultra-thin aluminum slabs measure just 1.2 mm in thickness but guarantee extraordinary graphic quality thanks to advanced digital printing technologies at very high resolution. Suitable for luxury hotels, residential interiors, and commercial environments like restaurants or retail spaces, the wallcoverings offer full flexibility in both form and function, allowing for customizable designs and finishes.


Tecnografica launches ‘Ultralight,’ 1.2mm aluminum slabs with customizable designs and finishes | all images courtesy of Technografica

changing the game in wallcoverings

Since its inception in 1992, Tecnografica has embraced a forward-thinking approach, continually pushing boundaries in wallcovering and decoration design. Guided by the motto ‘The Game is changing,’ the Italian brand seeks to challenge industry norms with cutting-edge technology and bold ideas. Their goal is to serve architecture and design professionals by providing versatile, high-quality products that reflect the latest trends, blending artistic expression with functional design.

‘With ULTRALIGHT we wanted to create a product that was not only aesthetically surprising, but also incredibly functional,’ explains Stefano Lamberti, Head of Sales and Marketing at Tecnografica. ‘We want to offer a versatile and innovative solution that allows, on the one hand, designers and architects to fully express their creativity and, on the other, national and international distributors to access this new covering through a concrete reduction in transport and logistics costs.’


despite their ultra-thin profile, the wallcoverings guarantee extraordinary graphic quality

ultralight’s three finishes pair function with form

Available in three finishes – Super Glossy, Matte, and 3D – the ‘Ultralight’ aluminum slabs cater to a variety of design needs. The glossy finish mimics the high elegance of marble and onyx, while the matt finish offers a more understated yet refined touch. Providing depth and texture, the three-dimensional surface replicates natural materials like concrete, wood or fabrics for a more immersive design experience.

Beyond aesthetics, ‘Ultralight’ surfaces are highly practical and sustainable thanks to a production process without gas emissions. Their lightweight construction makes them easy to transport and install, significantly reducing logistical costs. Additionally, their resistance to wear, tear, and weather ensures durability in both interior and exterior applications.


three finishes are available – Super Glossy, Matte, and 3D


Super Glossy is a mirror-effect finish that replicates polished marble, onyx, glass, and precious stones
